meanings.definition: To preserve the memory of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Families often spend time memorializing their loved ones by sharing stories and photos.
meanings.sent2: The community is memorializing the fallen soldiers with a special ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The children had a fun time memorializing their favorite toys in a pretend museum.
meanings.sent4: Her journal entries were like memorializing moments frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The artist did a beautiful job memorializing the landscape in a painting.

meanings.definition: To commemorate or honor through a memorial.
meanings.sent1: Every year, we gather to memorialize the heroes of our country.
meanings.sent2: The town is memorializing the founder by erecting a statue in the park.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to memorialize their teacher by planting a tree in the school yard.
meanings.sent4: The plaque on the bench memorializes the generous donor who made it possible.
meanings.sent5: The museum is memorializing the ancient civilization through a special exhibit.

meanings.definition: The act of creating a memorial.
meanings.sent1: The memorializing of the historic event brought the community together.
meanings.sent2: She dedicated herself to the memorializing of important figures in history.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the best memorializing design was fierce among the artists.
meanings.sent4: The city council approved the budget for the memorializing of the local heroes.
meanings.sent5: The museum's exhibit showcased different styles of memorializing throughout the centuries.
